George Floyd's death was an American
tragedy that sparked an outpouring of
anger and soul-searching but look at the
faces it wasn't just black America that
was appalled but white America too this
is a seismic shift in attitudes towards
police brutality and racism it was a

all the marches were black but now

it's the denial on the part of much of

you're a white American you might think

has surprised me in the past week has

George Floyd's brutal death held up a

if lasting change does come it will be
